Question: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 12 cups of sugar and 14 cups of flour. She already put in 10 cups of sugar. How many more cups of flour than cups of sugar does she need to add now?
Program:
sugar_needed = 12
flour_needed = 14
sugar_added = 10
# Follow up: how many more cups of flour than cups of sugar does she need to add now?
flour_needed_more = flour_needed - sugar_added
ans= flour_needed_more

Question: Julia played tag with 4 kids on wednesday. She had played with 6 kids on monday and 17 kids on tuesday. How many more kids did she play with on monday than on wednesday?
Program:
kids_played_on_monday = 6
kids_played_on_tuesday = 17
kids_played_on_wednesday = 4
# Follow up: how many more kids did she play with on monday than on wednesday?
kids_more_on_monday = kids_played_on_monday - kids_played_on_wednesday
ans= kids_more_on_monday

Question: Emily is making bead necklaces for her 44 friends. She made 26 necklaces and each necklace takes 2 beads. How many beads did Emily have?
Program:
beads_per_necklace = 2
number_of_necklaces = 26

# Follow up: how many beads did Emily have?
total_beads = beads_per_necklace * number_of_necklaces

ans = total_beads

Question: Bobby ate 33 pieces of candy. Then he ate 4 more. He also ate 14 pieces of chocolate. How many pieces of candy and chocolate did Bobby eat altogether?
Program:
pieces_of_candy = 33
pieces_of_candy_more = 4
pieces_of_chocolate = 14
# Follow up: how many pieces of candy and chocolate did Bobby eat altogether?
pieces_candy_and_chocolate = pieces_of_candy + pieces_of_candy_more + pieces_of_chocolate
ans= pieces_candy_and_chocolate

Question: After resting they decided to go for a swim. If the depth of the water is 10 times Dean's height and he stands at 9 feet How much deeper is the water than Dean's height?
Program:
dean_height = 9
water_depth = 10 * dean_height
# Follow up: How much deeper is the water than Dean's height?
difference_in_depth = water_depth - dean_height
ans= difference_in_depth

Question: Rebecca wants to split a collection of eggs into groups of 5. Rebecca has 10 marbles and 15 eggs. How many groups will be created?
Program:
total_eggs = 15
marbles = 10
group_size = 5
# Follow up: how many groups will be created?
num_groups = math.ceil(total_eggs/group_size)
ans= num_groups

Question: The ring toss game at the carnival made the same amount of money each day. In total in 30 days they earned 420 dollars. Together with game they earned 22 dollars. How much did ring toss game make per day?
Program:
total_earning_in_30_days = 420
total_earning_with_game = 22
# Follow up: how much did ring toss game make per day?
ring_toss_game_per_day = (total_earning_in_30_days - total_earning_with_game) / 30
ans= ring_toss_game_per_day

Question: Haley grew 9 trees in her backyard. After a typhoon 4 died. Then she grew 5 more trees. How many trees does she have left?
Program:
trees_before_typhoon = 9
trees_after_typhoon = 4
trees_grown_after_typhoon = 5
# Follow up: how many trees does she have left?
trees_left = trees_before_typhoon + trees_grown_after_typhoon - trees_after_typhoon
ans = trees_left

Question: Ed had 10 more marbles than Doug. Doug lost 11 of his marbles at the playground. If Ed had 45 marbles How many more marbles did Ed have than Doug then?
Program:
marbles_ed = 45
marbles_doug_before = marbles_ed - 10
marbles_doug_after = marbles_doug_before - 11
# Follow up: How many more marbles did Ed have than Doug then?
marbles_ed_more_than_doug = marbles_ed - marbles_doug_after
ans = marbles_ed_more_than_doug

Question: Dave had 21 apps on his phone. He added 89 new apps. After deleting some he had 24 left. How many more apps did he add than he deleted?
Program:
apps_before = 21
apps_after = 24
apps_added = 89
# Follow up: how many apps did he delete?
apps_deleted = apps_added - apps_after + apps_before
# Follow up: how many more apps did he add than he deleted?
apps_added_than_deleted = apps_added - apps_deleted
ans= apps_added_than_deleted

Question: A book has 2 chapters across 23 pages. The first chapter is 10 pages long. How many pages are in the first chapter?
Program:
pages_in_book = 23
pages_in_first_chapter = 10
# Follow up: how many pages are in the first chapter?
ans = pages_in_first_chapter

Question: Zachary did 15 push-ups in gym class today. David did 39 more push-ups than Zachary. John did 9 push-ups less than David. How many more push-ups did Zachary do than John?
Program:
zachary_pushups = 15
david_pushups = zachary_pushups + 39
john_pushups = davids_pushups - 9
# Follow up: How many more push-ups did Zachary do than John?
zachary_more_than_john = zachary_pushups - john_pushups
ans= zachary_more_than_john

Question: Debby bought 88 water bottles and 13 soda bottles when they were on sale. If she drank 4 water bottles and 87 soda bottles a day How many days would the water bottles last?
Program:
water_bottles_bought = 88
soda_bottles_bought = 13
water_bottles_consumed = 4
soda_bottles_consumed = 87

# Follow up: How many days would the water bottles last?
days_water_bottles_last = water_bottles_bought / water_bottles_consumed

ans= days_water_bottles_last

Question: White t - shirts can be purchased in packages of 53. If mom buys 57 packages of white t - shirts and 34 trousers How many white t - shirts will she have?
Program:
t_shirts_per_package = 53
no_of_packages_bought = 57
no_of_trousers_bought = 34
# Follow up: how many white t-shirts will she have?
total_no_of_t_shirts = t_shirts_per_package * no_of_packages_bought
# Follow up: how many more white t-shirts than trousers?
more_t_shirts_than_trousers = total_no_of_t_shirts - no_of_trousers_bought
ans= more_t_shirts_than_trousers

Question: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 25 sacks of unripe oranges and 5 sacks of ripe oranges per day. How many sacks of ripe oranges will they have after 73 days of harvest?
Program:
sacks_of_unripe_oranges_per_day = 25
sacks_of_ripe_oranges_per_day = 5
days_of_harvest = 73
# Follow up: how many sacks of ripe oranges will they have after 73 days of harvest?
total_sacks_of_ripe_oranges = sacks_of_ripe_oranges_per_day * days_of_harvest
ans = total_sacks_of_ripe_oranges

Question: There were 7 roses in the vase. Jessica cut some more roses from her flower garden which had a total of 59 roses. There are now 20 roses in the vase. How many roses did she cut?
Program:
”
roses_in_vase_before = 7
roses_in_vase_after = 20
roses_in_flower_garden = 59

# Follow up: how many roses did she cut?
roses_cut = roses_in_flower_garden - roses_in_vase_after + roses_in_vase_before

ans= roses_cut

Question: Matthew had 22 crackers and 34 cakes. If Matthew gave equal numbers of crackers and cakes to his 11 friends How many crackers did each person eat?
Program:
”
crackers = 22
cakes = 34
friends = 11
# Follow up: how many crackers did each person eat?
crackers_each_person = crackers // friends
ans = crackers_each_person

Question: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 12 cups of sugar and 14 cups of flour. She already put in 10 cups of sugar. How many more cups of flour than cups of sugar does she need to add now?
Program:
”
cups_sugar_needed = 12
cups_sugar_already_added = 10
cups_flour_needed = 14
# Follow up: how many more cups of flour does she need to add?
cups_flour_needed_to_add = cups_flour_needed - cups_sugar_already_added
# Follow up: how many more cups of flour than cups of sugar does she need to add now?
cups_flour_more_than_sugar = cups_flour_needed_to_add - cups_sugar_needed
ans= cups_flour_more_than_sugar
